document.docAuthor: Monné, Miguel A. & Monné, Marcela L.
document.masterDocTitle: Synopsis of the genus Pseudoperma Dillon and Dillon, 1946 (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae), with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Synopsis of the genus Pseudoperma Dillon and Dillon, 1946 (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae), with description of a new species

caption.paragraph:
Figure 1. (a)
Pseudoperma patruelis (Breuning)
, male; (b)
Pseudoperma chalcogramma (Bates)
, male; (c)
Pseudoperma lingafelteri
sp. nov. , holotype male; (d)
Pseudoperma patruelis
, lateral view, detail of meso- and metasternum (e)
Pseudoperma chalcogramma
, lateral view; detail of meso- and metasternum (f)
Pseudoperma lingafelteri
sp. nov , lateral view; detail of meso- and metasternum.

The tegument shows some colour variations according to the locality; the specimens from Santa Catarina are more reddish than the others from northern states. The antennal tubercles are prominent and acute, and the mesosternal process is flat and slightly declivous anteriorly.
